intro: Senecio ambavilla, commonly known as the Ambavilla groundsel, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. It features narrow, gray-green leaves and produces small yellow flowers that attract pollinators. Its structure and growth habits make it a resilient species in its native habitat.
